description: From Spanish bastonada (compare French bastonnade), from baston (“a stick or staff”).

entries.meaning: A blow with a cudgel or stick.
Beating the bare soles of the feet with a stick as a form of corporal punishment used primarily within prisons in various countries. The receiving person is required to be barefoot.

verbs.description: bastinado (third-person singular simple present bastinadoes, present participle bastinadoing, simple past and past participle bastinadoed)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To punish a person by beating the bare soles of the feet, using a stick or truncheon.
